article_title: India Asks IBM Unit to Pay More Tax, Says It Underreported Income
article_text:
NEW DELHI—India has asked International Business Machines Corp. to pay 53.57 billion rupees ($865 million) in taxes, a senior income-tax official said Friday, marking the latest global company to be targeted by Indian tax authorities.

The tax bill, sent to IBM's India unit on Monday, alleges the company underreported income for the financial year ended March 2009, said the official who decline to be named. He said tax authorities...

twitter.description: India's tax office has asked IBM to pay $865 million in taxes, alleging that the technology company's local unit has underreported its income.
twitter.creator: @McLainSean

image.alt: India orders IBM's local unit to pay more tax, says it underreported income
